headline.main: NICARAGUA.; Another Version of the San Juan Difficulty.

docs.lead_paragraph: A correspondent of the New-Orleans Crescent, writing from San Juan de Nicaragua, pats forth a statement of the recent difficulty at that port between the constituted authorities and the Accessory Transit Company, which places some of the facts in a new light. The particulars are interesting: SAN JUAN DEL NORTE. April 10, 1853.
docs.abstract: Nine of the San Juan affair

headline.main: BOSTON.; May Day--Lectures on Poetry--Poole's Index, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: May has come in with its usual severity. This is May Day; but it might as well be the Idea of March-the winds are so high, blowing from the South with Auster-ity, and the dust flying everywhere. Seen from a short distance, Boston seemed yesterday and to-day, enveloped in a pale road colored atmosphere.

headline.main: ANNIVERSARY SEASON; Sixth Annual Meeting of the American Medical Association.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Association met yesterday (second day,) in Bleecker-street Prtsbyterian Church, at 9 A. M. There was a large attendance of delegates. Dr. E. L. BEADLE, Secretary, read the minutes, which were adopted.
docs.snippet: The Association met yesterday (second day,) in Bleecker-street Prtsbyterian Church, at 9 A. M. There was a large attendance of delegates. Dr. E. L. BEADLE, Secretary, read the minutes, which were adopted.

docs.lead_paragraph: None better than educated physicians, know the evils of over-eating or of living too well, and hence none better appreciate a dinner that is exactly right, and in all respects a good one.

headline.main: RURAL ECONOMY.; Gleanings of Fact and Practice in Fruit Culture. The Cherry.

docs.lead_paragraph: General Remarks.--The Cherry is found in almost every part of Europe, also in the northern part of Africa, and in Asia, in which latter region it had its origin. It was brought by LUCULLUS, about half a century before the Christian era, from Cerasus, a city of Pontus, and from this its name is derived.

headline.main: Father Gavazzi at Metropolitan Hall.; SECOND SERIES. LECTURE V--RELICS AND IMAGES.

docs.lead_paragraph: The attendance last evening at Father GAVAZZI'S lecture in Metropolitan Hall was highly respectable, but not very numerous. The lecturer observed that the subject of the evening was as above stated, and intimated that he would treat the matter not theoretically, but practically.

docs.lead_paragraph: To THE PUBLIC.--I feel it a duty I owe to those who are suffering under the severe affliction of throat and lung complaints, to bear this unsought testimony to the superior skill and beneficial effects of Dr. LUTENER'S treatment, lately introduced into this country by the discoverer, Dr. LUTENER, an English physician of high reputation.

docs.lead_paragraph: It seems pretty certain that Chatham-street and the Bowery are to be paved with the Russ pavement. The process will be expensive,--but the project, nevertheless, has the recommendation, (unusual enough to be noted,) that the City will have something to show for its money.
